io.github.whippetdb.db.internal

Class HybridDb

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.whippetdb.db.internal.HybridDb
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Db

    public class HybridDb
extends java.lang.Object
implements Db
    Represents fixed-size fields as limited var-size

      • keySize

        public java.lang.Integer keySize()
        Description copied from interface: Db
        Key size, non-null indicates that this db has fixed-size keys. If present, keyLen parameter in seek()/put()/delete() is ignored.
        Specified by:

      • maxKeySize

        public java.lang.Integer maxKeySize()
        Description copied from interface: Db
        Max key size, if known. If present, keyLen parameter in seek()/put()/delete() is checked against it.
        Specified by:
        maxKeySize in interface Db

      • maxValueSize

        public java.lang.Integer maxValueSize()
        Description copied from interface: Db
        Max value size, if known. If present, operations on value in seek()/put() are checked against it.
        Specified by:
        maxValueSize in interface Db

      • seek

        public <T> T seek(MemIO key,
                  long keyOff,
                  int keyLen,
                  Db.SeekHandler<T> handler)
        Description copied from interface: Db
        Visit a value for a key. If the key doesn't exist, a handler will receive null arguments. A handler is allowed to change the value on the fly. If the db has fixed-size keys: - keyLen is ignored (the db will use the size it knows). If the db has fixed-size values: - reading/writing is checked against this size, - initially value is filled by zeros, all changes are persistent. If the db has variable-size keys: - keyLen is respected, - if maxKeySize is present, keyLen is checked against it. If the db has variable-size values: - value may be cast to MemDataBuffer and resized - reading/writing follow the rules for MemDataBuffer - if maxValueSize is present, reading/writing/resizing is checked against it
        Specified by:
        seek in interface Db
        Parameters:
        key - - key memory
        keyOff - - key start
        keyLen - - key length
        handler - - value handler

      • put

        public <T> T put(MemIO key,
                 long keyOff,
                 int keyLen,
                 Db.PutHandler<T> handler)
        Description copied from interface: Db
        Insert or visit a value for a key. The boolean parameter of a handler indicates whether the key was just inserted. The value is always non-null. A handler is allowed to change the value on the fly. If the db has fixed-size keys: - keyLen is ignored (the db will use the size it knows). If the db has fixed-size values: - reading/writing is checked against this size, - initially value is filled by zeros, all changes are persistent. If the db has variable-size keys: - keyLen is respected, - if maxKeySize is present, keyLen is checked against it. If the db has variable-size values: - value may be cast to MemDataBuffer and resized, - reading/writing follow the rules for MemDataBuffer, - initially value is empty (zero-size), all changes are persistent, - if maxValueSize is present, reading/writing/resizing is checked against it.
        Specified by:
        put in interface Db
        Parameters:
        key - - key memory
        keyOff - - actual key start
        keyLen - - actual key length

      • scan

        public void scan(Db.ScanHandler handler)

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Description copied from interface: Db
        Mark the end of transaction. In general, the transaction is NOT immediately persisted. The immediate durability may be enabled by DbBuilder flags.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface Db

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Db
        Close the backing file. If journaling is enabled, persist all transactions to the main file and delete the transaction log.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Db
